botanical_details.genus: Magnolia can be deciduous or evergreen trees or shrubs, with large, showy, often fragrant flowers, often opening before the leaves, and sometimes followed by colourful cone-like fruit

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in moist, humus-rich, well-drained neutral to acid soil in sun or partial shade with shelter from cold winds. Late frosts may damage flower buds. Further magnolia cultivation advice
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by softwood and greenwood cuttings in early summer or semi-hardwood cuttings in late summer to early winter
how_to_grow.pruning: Magnolia pruning should be carried out in midsummer when in full leaf
how_to_grow.pests: May be damaged by horse chestnut scale, capsid bug and snails
how_to_grow.diseases: May be affected by coral spot, grey mould, honey fungus, a virus, fungal leaf spot or iron deficiency and lime-induced chlorosis
